title: American Soccer Analysis API Client
text: itscalledsoccer wrapper around API powers American Soccer Analysis app. enables R users programmatically retrieve advanced analytics favorite players teams, coverage following competitions: Major League Soccer National Women’s Soccer League USL Championship USL League One USL Super League MLS NEXT Pro North American Soccer League (defunct)

title: American Soccer Analysis API Client
code: # Install release version from CRAN install.packages("itscalledsoccer")  # Install development version from GitHub devtools::install_github("American-Soccer-Analysis/itscalledsoccer-r")

title: American Soccer Analysis API Client
text: Initialize main class new method. ’re environment proxy server required, need need alter CURL options, can pass number httr configs initializing class. Use discretion.
code: asa_client <- AmericanSoccerAnalysis$new() asa_client <- AmericanSoccerAnalysis$new(     httr::config(ssl_verifypeer = 0L),     httr::use_proxy("64.251.21.73", 8080) )

title: American Soccer Analysis API Client
text: get_* methods can used retrieve data made available American Soccer Analysis app. Partial matches abbreviations accepted player team names. methods, arguments must named. Additionally, dataframes complete players, teams, games, also available joining additional information. variety examples , full documentation can found .
code: # Initialize the main class asa_client <- AmericanSoccerAnalysis$new() # Access dataframes of games, players, teams, and more from the ASA client object created above all_games <- asa_client$games all_teams <- asa_client$teams all_players <- asa_client$players  # see league options asa_client$LEAGUES # Get all players named "Dax" dax_players <- asa_client$get_players(names = "Dax") # Get cumulative player shot information (i.e., xgoals) from the NWSL over three seasons # see other parameters in package documentation asa_xgoals <- asa_client$get_player_xgoals(     leagues = "nwsl",      season_name = c(2021:2023),      split_by_seasons = FALSE) head(shots_df) # Get season-by-season shot information (i.e., xgoals) for all players named "Dax" in MLS asa_xgoals <- asa_client$get_player_xgoals(     leagues = "mls",     player_names = "Dax",     split_by_seasons = TRUE )  # Join player names library(dplyr) asa_xgoals <- asa_xgoals %>%     left_join(all_players,               by = "player_id") # Get player passing information (i.e., xpass) from MLS in 2023 asa_xpass <- asa_client$get_player_xpass(     leagues = "mls",      season_name = 2023)  # Get cumulative/career xPass data for all USL League One teams asa_xpass <- asa_client$get_team_xpass(     leagues = "usl1" ) # Get team g+ information (i.e., goals added) from MLS library(tidyr)  # tall version asa_goals_added <- asa_client$get_team_goals_added(     leagues = "mls",      season_name = 2023) %>%     tidyr::unnest(data)  # wide version asa_goals_added <- asa_client$get_team_goals_added(     leagues = "mls",      season_name = 2023) %>%     tidyr::unnest(data) %>%     tidyr::pivot_wider( id_cols = team_id,                          names_from = action_type,                          values_from = c(num_actions_for:goals_added_against))  # Get game-by-game goals added (g+) data for all goalkeepers named "Matt Turner" asa_goals_added <- asa_client$get_goalkeeper_goals_added(     leagues = c("mls", "uslc"),     player_names = "Matt Turner",     split_by_game = TRUE )

title: American Soccer Analysis API Client — AmericanSoccerAnalysis
text: Class representing active session connected American Soccer Analysis public API.

title: American Soccer Analysis API Client — AmericanSoccerAnalysis
text: take arguments initialize.

title: American Soccer Analysis API Client — AmericanSoccerAnalysis
text: API_VERSION Latest API version. MAX_API_LIMIT Maximum number requests returned API default. LEAGUES List stylized league names. base_url API base URL. players Data frame containing players leagues. teams Data frame containing teams leagues. stadia Data frame containing stadia leagues. managers Data frame containing managers leagues. referees Data frame containing referees leagues. httr_configs Configs pass httr functions. See documentation. latest_update_timestamp Keeps record latest update timestamp queried data. Used conditionally clear client-side cache.

text: leagues Leagues filter. Accepts character vector length >= 1. game_ids Game IDs filter. Accepts character vector length >= 1. team_ids Team IDs filter. combined team_names. Accepts character vector length >= 1. team_names Team names filter. Partial matches abbreviations accepted. combined team_ids. Accepts character vector length >= 1. seasons Name(s)/year(s) seasons. See API documentation possible values. Accepts character vector length >= 1. stages Describes stage competition game took place. See API documentation possible values. Accepts character vector length >= 1.

title: American Soccer Analysis API Client — AmericanSoccerAnalysis
American Soccer Analysis API Client — AmericanSoccerAnalysis
text: leagues Leagues filter. Accepts character vector length >= 1. ... following arguments parsed: minimum_minutes: Minimum threshold sum minutes played. minimum_shots: Minimum threshold sum shots taken. minimum_key_passes: Minimum threshold sum key passes. player_ids: Player IDs filter. combined player_names. Accepts character vector length >= 1. player_names: Player names filter. Partial matches accepted. combined player_ids. Accepts character vector length >= 1. team_ids: Team IDs filter. combined team_names. Accepts character vector length >= 1. team_names: Team names filter. Partial matches abbreviations accepted. combined team_ids. Accepts character vector length >= 1. season_name: Name(s)/year(s) seasons. combined date range. See API documentation possible values. Accepts character vector length >= 1. start_date: Start date range. Must string YYYY-MM-DD format. combined season_name. end_date: End date range. Must string YYYY-MM-DD format. combined season_name. shot_pattern: Describes possessing actions leading shot. Valid keywords include: 'Set piece', 'Corner', 'Free kick', 'Penalty', 'Fastbreak', 'Regular'. Accepts character vector length >= 1. split_by_teams: Logical indicator group results team. split_by_seasons: Logical indicator group results season. split_by_games: Logical indicator group results game. stage_name: Describes stage competition game took place. See API documentation possible values. Accepts character vector length >= 1. general_position: Describes common position played player specified period time. Valid keywords include: 'GK', 'CB', 'FB', 'DM', 'CM', '', 'W', 'ST'. Accepts character vector length >= 1.

title: itscalledsoccer 0.1.0
text: first release itscalledsoccer, wrapper around API powers American Soccer Analysis app. enables R users programmatically retrieve advanced analytics favorite players teams, coverage following competitions: Major League Soccer National Women’s Soccer League USL Championship USL League One MLS NEXT Pro North American Soccer League (defunct) ASA, working better part 6 months super excited release . hope makes interacting data easier allows people build new informative things.

title: itscalledsoccer 0.1.0
text: Technically everything package new, ’ll highlight functions currently available provide brief description data return. package take couple seconds initialize cache data start. get_stadia: Gets data stadiums, things like location, name capacity. get_referees: Gets data referees, things like name, birth date nationality. get_managers: Gets data managers, things like name nationality. get_teams: Gets data teams, things like abbreviation name. get_players: Gets data players, things like height, weight nationality. get_games: Gets data games, things like score, attendance matchday. get_player_xgoals: Gets player(s) xGoals season range dates. get_player_xpass: Gets player(s) xPass season range dates. get_player_goals_added: Gets player(s) g+ season range dates. get_player_salaries: Gets player(s) salary season range dates, available MLS. get_goalkeeper_xgoals: Gets goalkeepers(s) xGoals season range dates. get_goalkeeper_goals_added: Gets goalkeepers(s) g+ season range dates. get_team_xgoals: Gets team(s) xGoals season range dates. get_team_xpass: Gets team(s) xPass season range dates. get_team_goals_added: Gets team(s) xPass season range dates. get_team_salaries: Gets team(s) salary season range dates, available MLS. get_game_xgoals: Gets game(s) xGoals season range dates. info xGoals, xPass g+, check articles: xGoals Explanation Updated Expected Passing Model Goals Added

title: itscalledsoccer 0.1.0
text: None, find bug using package, please submit issue.

title: itscalledsoccer 0.1.0
text: know documentation bit sparse moment, plan building adding examples time. meantime, API documentation sufficient stop gap specific functions. Happy soccering!
